Text:
(Time is supposed to iron out all interpersonal
conflicts arising from emotion.)

(Even if you lose something important, the sadness of
that won't remain unchanged after a decade. Feelings
eventually fade away.)

(The same goes for positive emotions like happiness
or joy.)

(And even if that mental state is, say, rage, it
will diminish as time marches on.)

(Therefore, the best way to deal with these kinds of
problems is to do nothing.)

(...That's my theory, at least, but it seems my
sister needed longer to cool off.)
(Guess one day wasn't enough.)

Do you know what I was thinking while I waited
outside your dorm?
Nope.

I was beating you to a pulp in my head. Over and over
again.
And my fury doubled with each passing second.

(Now I know there's a type of anger that grows with
time.)
Not like you care, right?
What? No, that's not true.
Wanna bet how long someone can go without air?

When you strangle someone, they pass out because
you're cutting off the blood flow through their
carotid artery. Air has nothing to do with it.

Oh, whatever. Now, do you remember swearing that you
would come home during summer vacation?
Did I?

You're always like this. Tossing aside your promises
to me without a care.
I'll do my best to become a man who keeps his word.
Would you mind getting off of me now?

Claire releases her grip on my neck, but she's still
sitting on top of me.
Here's your last chance.
What's this?

A reserved seat for the Bushin Festival. You can't
just get them anywhere.

It's yours, so come watch the matches and learn
something.

That reminds me, didn't you say you aren't competing
this year?
What?

I'm going as the academy representative in place of
Princess Rose. Don't tell me you didn't know your
own sister was participating.
O-Oh yeah, I knew. I was just checking...

(Claire seizes my neck in another death grip and gets
right up in my face so she can look me in the eye,
just like how bad guys do it when they threaten
someone.)
Say, you remember my birthday, right?
O-Of course.

I should hope so. And I trust you've also memorized
my tournament results.
O-Of course.

Good. And you better not forget them if you want to
live a long and happy life.
This is the year I win...
so make absolutely sure that you're there.
I will.

Claire leaves the room, glaring daggers at me the
entire way out.
Phew, I'm beat.
(The real fun begins tomorrow.)
Maybe I'll run through things in my head a few times.
With that, I close my eyes.
She moved out?
Yes, just the other day, and quite suddenly too.

She said that she would be going abroad for an
extended time to conduct research.
A folder of papers lay on the desk.

Notes on major Orianan businesses and religious
groups along with their connections to the royal
family...

"I'll get you information," huh? I seriously can't
stand her.

...Sorry you went to the trouble, but I don't need
your pity.
Especially when I don't have any left for myself.
